alert.note: Alert for Darlington (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Darlington County through 830 PM EDT... At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Cassatt, or 8 miles northwest of Bishopville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartsville, Darlington, Lamar, North Hartsville, Dovesville, Mont Clare, Lydia, Darlington Raceway, Auburn, Swift Creek, Clyde, Mechanicsville, Oats, Floyd, Kellytown, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Society Hill and Carolina Pines Regional Medical Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 125 and 138. Interstate 95 in South Carolina mile marker 146 and near mile marker 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
